result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: No contact with PMM 12/13/1986, no possession of alcohol.  Contact with minor children as permitted by DHS is allowed.
No contact with PMM 12/13/1986, no possession of alcohol.  Contact with minor children as permitted by DHS is allowed.

1:51 PM Defendant Rose L Barfield in court, in custody from the Dunn County Jail.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Rose L Barfield.  Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin. A. Standaert - Clerk 

22CF71, 21CM335, 22CF231, 22CM32

Atty Rivard - deft is restricted from her residence on all bonds, asking to lift that restriction - PMM has now relocated, also asking for modification of bond to be allowed contact with JCE, LMM, DRB per DHS rules in cases 22CF71 & 22CF231, asks for modification of cash bond in 22CF71 to sign bond, asks for modification of cash bond in 22CF231 to sign bond

State - no objection to removal of no contact with residence, Court already allowed communication with children as allowed by CHIPS actions, objects to modification of cash component of bonds

Atty Rivard - makes argument
Court - speaks to deft
Deft - makes statement to the Court
Court - will modify bond if deft has inpatient setup, will not modify cash bond amounts, removes no contact with residence, allows contact with minor children as permitted by DHS
Bail/bond hearing on August 26, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Motion to Modify Bond
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
No contact with PMM 12/13/1986, no possession of alcohol, no contact with residence *address confidential*.  Contact with children allowed by CHIPS actions.

No contact with PMM 12/13/1986, no possession of alcohol, no contact with residence *address confidential*.  Contact with children allowed by CHIPS actions.

22CF71, 21CM335, 22CM32

State - objects to modification of bond
Court - modifies bond in 21CM335 & 21CM32 to $500 sign bond - no contact PMM 12/13/1986, no possession of alcohol, no contact with residence - 22CF71 $2500 sign bond - contact with children allowed by CHIPS actions (same conditions as CM cases)

4:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Rose L Barfield appeared in court, in custody in the Dunn County Jail, Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard for Rose L Barfield appeared in court. A. Standaert - Clerk 

21CM335, 22CF71, 22CM32

4:02 pm  State - calls Officer Josh Draeger who is sworn in and testifies
State - offers exhibit 1
Atty Rivard - no objection to exhibit 1
Court - receives exhibit 1
Officer Josh Draeger identifies deft
4:15 pm  Atty Rivard - cross-examination of Officer Josh Draeger
4:20 pm  State - re-direct of Officer Josh Draeger

4:21 pm Officer Josh Draeger is excused

Neither party has any other witnesses

State - makes argument for the Court to find probable cause and bind deft over for trial

Court - finds probable cause and binds deft over for trial

Court - amends bond conditions to: Defendant is allowed to have contact with PMM (12/13/86) regarding any child in his care or that lives with him through electronic means.  Defendant may also have contact with those children through PMM (12/13/86)
